inclusion.criterion: first presentation of MBC, regardless of ER and HER2 status of the primary tumor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: non-rapidly progressive MBC, not requiring urgent initiation of chemotherapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: no recent significant worsening of MBC related signs and symptoms according to patient history
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: liver metastases: no significant increase in liver function tests alanine aminotransferase aspartate transaminase (ASAT) and alanine transaminase (ALAT) in 2 weeks prior to screening visit
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: standard imaging work-up of MBC was recently performed
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: measurable or clinically evaluable disease on recent standard work up of MBC
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: histological biopsy can safely be obtained according to standard clinical care procedures
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: primary tumor blocks available for confirmatory central laboratory ER/HER2 testing in the UMCG
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient is able to undergo PET imaging procedures
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: age >18 years of age, willing and able to comply with the protocol as judged by the investigator
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: contraindications for systemic treatment (as will be assigned based on biopsy and experimental scan results)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: prior allergic reaction to immunoglobulins or immunoglobulin allergy
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: inability to comply with study procedures
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: rapidly progressive (visceral) disease requiring rapid initiation of chemotherapy
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 42 year-old postmenopausal woman who had a screening sonogram which revealed an abnormality in the right breast. She had no palpable masses on breast exam.
